comment.body: If i have a problem I tell them, and they say they'll look into it. Okay. Asking about it the next day. Then the next. Then every day if required. (But I live in a country where the provider tells in the ToS what service they provide and they have to pay back if they fail to do it. True that average users are ignorant enough not to know about it.)
Well I prefer open source open protocols. Syncthing, fully cross-platform, secure, fast, reliable. Bittorrent requires $$$ to work properly, or not even then.
Sure, paying with the mobile phone. Right there. Lucky that there are no mobile phone viruses, trojans, etc.... :-D
it's full of bloatware shit, though. plenty of data leaking everywhere. and they reorganised the fucking android setup menu, beargh.
